name: How (Not) To Defuse Bombs
description:
My mini-game entry for Ludum Dare 49 with the theme "Unstable". This time I ended up a little bit too far from the original theme.

In the game, you'll become a student of bomb defusing. You will have to use your intuition and wisdom to solve the wide variety of (three) levels.

Can you defuse all the bombs in time? Or will you end up high in the skies?

According to Ludum Dare COMPO rules, this game is released with source code available at GitHub. Please, be aware that the game was kinda rushed and the code is terrible and unmaintainable with a lot of anti-patterns (see Spaghetti code).

This game is made with Löve, an awesome game framework that allows you to write games in Lua.

The game also uses a beautiful BitPotion font by Joeb Rogers.
